channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tech stocks go into free fall as it dawns on traders that AI has the ability to cut revenues across the board
item.description: Tech companies are waking up to the fact that AI may be more likely to replace them than help them.

item.title: How 2026 Winter Olympics Security Is Preparing For The Opening Ceremony
item.description: Thousands of police and security officers will work during the Milan-Cortina Games’ opening ceremony. The involvement of some U.S. ICE personnel has s...

item.title: Minneapolis Children Describe ‘Living in Fear,’ and China’s President Carries Out a Mass Purge
item.description: Plus, a fitting tribute to Catherine O’Hara.

item.title: Ken Griffin is apparently done with ‘sucking up’ to the White House
item.description: "Most CEOs just don't want to find themselves in the business of having to, in some sense, suck up to one administration after another to succeed in r...

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Resume Talks After a Huge Attack by Moscow
item.description: U.S., Russian and Ukrainian negotiators are meeting in the United Arab Emirates, but Russia continues to pummel Ukraine and has not softened demands t...

item.title: Ex-Capitol Police Officer Harry Dunn Seeks Maryland House Seat
item.description: Mr. Dunn, who rose to prominence for defending the Capitol during the Jan. 6 riot, will run for a hotly contested Southern Maryland seat.

item.title: Crypto crime-fighting startup TRM Labs notches $1 billion valuation with new $70 million funding round
item.description: With its blockchain analytics tools, TRM Labs helps private companies and agencies like the FBI track illicit finance.

item.title: Ro CEO wants to erase GLP-1 stigma with first Super Bowl ad featuring Serena Williams
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie to Skip Olympics as Search for Mother, Nancy Guthrie, Yields Few Clues
item.description: The “Today” anchor withdrew from NBC’s coverage of the Winter Games in Italy as investigators acknowledged they had few answers about who may have tak...

item.title: Palantir CEO Alex Karp says Trump has a point about the AI race: ‘there’s a real hesitance to adopt these kind of products in the West’
item.description: Alex Karp said he sees a real "lack of adoption in Canada, Northern Europe, and in Europe in general." It's terrible news for politics, he added.

item.title: For Peace, More Ukrainians Consider the Once Unthinkable: Surrendering Land
item.description: Polls show a growing acceptance of territorial concessions among a war-weary public, if Ukraine receives strong security guarantees.

item.title: A Hamas Hostage’s Secret Ordeal
item.description: Guy Gilboa-Dalal says he was sexually abused by one of his captors in the tunnels of Gaza and threatened with death if he said anything.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Resume Talks After a Huge Attack by Moscow
item.description: U.S., Russian and Ukrainian negotiators are meeting in the United Arab Emirates, but Russia continues to pummel Ukraine and has not softened demands t...

item.title: At Least 15 Die in Rare Collision Between Migrant Boat and Greek Patrol Vessel
item.description: Deadly shipwrecks often occur in the Aegean Sea, which is one of the main maritime routes to Europe, but they generally involve migrant boats sinking ...
